intro: Corydalis speciosa var. pterophora, commonly known as the winged corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Fumariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant features slender, ascending stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are arranged in clusters, making it a visually striking addition to gardens. Corydalis speciosa var. pterophora prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens.
